reviews.review_msg: Her lecture slides are pretty vague and the content (in my opinion) is hard to wrap your head around. There's so many articles. So many. All mandatory.

she posts the textbooks pdf on canvas so you dont need to spend extra money on the class which is great but its followed often by 2 other readings (which she also puts on canvas) each week so its really heavy :( i actually liked how the midterm was weighted cos it saved me from the low grades i got on the papers

Great prof, LOTS of reading

There are multiple readings for every week of lecture. The midterm test is worth 40% of the final grade and requires a large amount of studying, TAs are awesome and clearly enjoy anthropology which helps. Recommend the course as an elective to learn more about the field.

It was an interesting introductory course. Each week had 3 readings assigned from different texts, thus was pretty heavy. I enjoyed this class but it bothered me how heavily weighted the midterm exam was, when we had 3 assignments and a final paper. Weighting an exam at 40% in an anthropology course seems counter-intuitive.
